entry.title: Publications
entry.summary: In press / recently published Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Petri Ylikoski (2021) Explaining Institutional Change, to appear in the Oxford Handbook…
entry.content:
In press / recently published

  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Petri Ylikoski (2021) Explaining Institutional Change, to appear in the Oxford Handbook of the Philosophy of Political Science, edited by Harold Kincaid, and Jeroen Van Bouwel. Oxford: Oxford University Press.
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Samuli Reijula; Petri Ylikoski (2020) Argumentative Landscapes: the functions of models in social epistemology, Synthese, https://doi.org/10.1007/s11229-020-02661-9 (ğŸ”“ Open Access)

Books

The Invisible Hand in Economics: How Economists Explain Unintended Social Consequences, INEM Advances in Economic Methodology, London: Routledge, 2008.

Economics Made Fun:Â Philosophy of the pop-economics, edited by N. Emrah Aydinonat & Jack Vromen, London: Routledge, 2015

Ä°ktisat Nedir?, Ä°letiÅŸim YayÄ±nlarÄ±,Â  2014

in Turkish, What is Economics?

HayatÄ±n Ä°Ã§indeki Ä°ktisat: Ä°ktisadi DavranÄ±ÅŸlara FarklÄ± Bir BakÄ±ÅŸ (with Ãœ. BarÄ±ÅŸ Urhan), Ä°letiÅŸim YayÄ±nlarÄ±,Â 

in Turkish, Economics in (Everyday) Life: Another Look at Economic Behavior

GÃ¶rÃ¼nmez Adam Smith, (with Mine Kara) Ä°letiÅŸim YayÄ±nlarÄ±,Â  2010

in Turkish, The Invisible Adam Smith

Modern UluslararasÄ± Ä°ktisat Teorisinin KÃ¶kenleri: KarÅŸÄ±laÅŸtÄ±rmalÄ± ÃœstÃ¼nlÃ¼kler, Neo-Klasik Fiyat Teorisi ve Heckscher-Ohlin Teoremi, Siyasal YayÄ±nevi, Ankara, 2007,

in Turkish, Roots of Modern International Economics: Comparative Advantages, Neoclassic Price Theory and the Heckscher-Ohlin Theorem

Â 

Articles

  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Petri Ylikoski (2021) Explaining Institutional Change, to appear in the Oxford Handbook of the Philosophy of Political Science, edited by Harold Kincaid, and Jeroen Van Bouwel. Oxford: Oxford University Press.
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Samuli Reijula; Petri Ylikoski (2020) Argumentative Landscapes: the functions of models in social epistemology, Synthese, https://doi.org/10.1007/s11229-020-02661-9 (ğŸ”“ Open Access)
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah and Emin KÃ¶ksal (2019) "Explanatory Value in Context: The Curious Case of Hotelling's Location Model", The European Journal of the History of Economic Thought, 26 (5): 879-910 https://doi.org/10.1080/09672567.2019.1626460
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah and P. Ylikoski (2018) "Three conceptions of a theory of institutions",Â  Philosophy of the Social Sciences,Â 48(6), 550â€“568.Â DOI: 10.1177/0048393118798619
    Ungated version available at TUHATÂ 
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2018) "The Diversity of Models as a Means to Better Explanations in Economics", Journal of Economic Methodology, 25(3),Â 237-251.Â DOI:Â 10.1080/1350178X.2018.1488478
    Pre-print available at SSRN & ResearchGate.
  • AydÄ±nonat, N. Emrah (2018) "Philosophy of Economics Rules: introduction to the symposium,Â Journal of Economic Methodology, 25(3),Â 211-217.Â https://doi.org/10.1080/1350178X.2018.1503143
    Pre-print available at: ResearchGate
  • AydÄ±nonat, N. Emrah & Petri Ylikoski (2014) â€œUnderstanding with Theoretical Modelsâ€œ, Journal of Economic Methodology,Â 21 (1): 19-36.Â http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/1350178X.2014.886470
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2012) â€œâ€˜People are not usually stupidâ€™ but is this enough for economics?â€, History of Economic Ideas,Â XX (3): 153-63 (A review essay on Maurice Lagueuxâ€™s Rationality and Explanation in Economics)Â Â https://www.jstor.org/stable/23723686
    Available @ResearchGate
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2012) â€œThe two images of economics: Why the fun disappears when difficult questions are at stake?â€œ, Journal of Economic Methodology,19 (3): 243â€“58.Â https://doi.org/10.1080/1350178X.2012.714142
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2011) "The Origin of Money: Interdisciplinary Perspectives", inÂ  GanÃŸmann, H. (ed.) New Approaches to Monetary Economics and Theory: Interdisciplinary Perspectives (Routledge International Studies in Money and Banking), London: Routledge, forthcoming.
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2010) Neuroeconomics: More than inspiration, less than revolution, Journal of Economic Methodology, 17 (2): 159 - 169.Â https://doi.org/10.1080/13501781003756444
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2007) Models, conjectures and exploration: an analysis of Schelling's checkerboard model of residential segregation, Journal of Economic Methodology, Volume 14 Issue 4, pp. 429 - 454.Â https://doi.org/10.1080/13501780701718680
  • AydÄ±nonat, N. E., (2005) "An interview with Thomas C. Schelling: Interpretation of game theory and the checkerboard model." Economics Bulletin, 2 (2): pp. 1-7
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Is the Invisible Hand un-Smithian? A Comment on Rothschild," Economics Bulletin, 2 (1): pp. 1-8.
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2006) "Game Theoretic Models as a Framework for Analysis" in Aktan, C. C. (ed.) Advances in Economics: Theory and Applications, Vol 2, Ä°zmir: AnÄ±l MatbaacÄ±lÄ±k.

E., (2006) "Institutions: Theory, History and Context-Specific Analysis" History of Economic Ideas 3 (A Review essay on Avner Greif, Institutions and the Path to the Modern Economy: Lessons from Medieval Trade, Cambridge, Cambridge University Pres, 2006, xx + 503.)Â https://www.jstor.org/stable/23722866

entry.title: CV
entry.summary: Education Degrees awarded Ph.D. September 2004. Erasmus Institute for Philosophy and Economics (EIPE), Erasmus School of Philosophy, Erasmus University Rotterdam,…
entry.content:
Education

Degrees awarded

  • Ph.D. September 2004. Erasmus Institute for Philosophy and Economics (EIPE),Â  Erasmus School of Philosophy, Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL.
  • M.Phil. Philosophy and Economics. August 1999. EIPE, Erasmus School of Philosophy, Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL.
  • MA. Economics. July 1998. Faculty of Political Science, Ankara University, TR.
  • B.Sc. Economics. July 1995. Faculty of Political Science, Ankara University, TR.

Title of docent

  • Docent (Practical Philosophy). December 2019. University of Helsinki.
  • Docent (Economic Thought). March 2012. Higher Education Council of Turkey, TR.

Employment

Current position

  • Researcher. Practical Philosophy, Faculty of Social Sciences, University of Helsinki. 02.2016â€”present.

Past positions

  • Associate Professor. BahÃ§eÅŸehir University, Faculty of Economics, Administrative & Social Sciences, Ä°stanbul, Turkey, 09.2012â€”02.2016
  • Assistant Professor, International Economics and Economic Growth Chair, Department of Economics, Faculty of Social Sciences, Ankara University, Ankara, Turkey, 03.2008 â€“ 09.2012.
  • Researcher, TINT, Department of Social and Moral Philosophy Group, University of Helsinki, FI, 09.2008 - 09.2009.
  • Lecturer, Department of Economics, Faculty of Social Sciences, Ankara University, TR, 02.2005 â€“ 03.2008.
  • Research and Teaching Assistant, Department of Economics, Faculty of Social Sciences, Ankara University, TR, 08.1996 â€“ 02-2005.

Visiting and Adjunct Positions

  • Visiting lecturer. Faculty of Philosohy. Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL. May-June 2019.
  • Visiting lecturer. Faculty of Philosohy. Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL. May-June 2018
  • Adjunct Associate Professor. BoÄŸaziÃ§i University, Ä°stanbul, TR. 2012-201.
  • Adjunct Assistant Professor. BoÄŸaziÃ§i University, Dept. of Economics, 09.2009 â€“02.2012.
  • Adjunct Assistant Professor. Galatasaray University, Dept. of Economics, 09.2010 â€“ 09. 2012.
  • Adjunct Assistant Professor. YÄ±ldÄ±z Technical University, Dept. of Economics, 09.2011 â€“ 09. 2012.

Research associate

  • Research Associate, Trend and Tensions in Intellectual Integration [TINT], University of Helsinki, FI | 09.2009 â€“ 02.2016.
  • Research Associate, Economic Policy Research Foundation of Turkey. TEPAV | Think-Tank, Ankara, TR, 01.2012â€”07.2017

Teaching

  • Highly experienced. Taught economics and philosophy courses to diverse sets of undergraduate and graduate students at several institutions including University of Helsinki (FI), Erasmus University Rotterdam (NL), Tallinn Technology University, Estonian Business School (EST), Ankara University (TR), BoÄŸaziÃ§i University (TR), Galatasaray University (TR).
  • Completed courses. University Pedagogy 1. Learning in Higher Education, spring 2019. University of Helsinki.

Service

Editorships

  • Chief editor, Journal of Economic Methodology, starting from 01.2020 (w/ Jack Vromen).
  • Associate editor, Journal of Economic Methodology, 09.2016â€”01.2020.
  • Member of the Editorial Board, History of Economic Ideas, 12.2014â€”present.

Guest Editor / Special Issues

  • Guest Editor. Synthese Special Issue on Unrealistic Models (w/ Uskali MÃ¤ki & Till GrÃ¼ne-Yanoff) 01-2019â€”present.
  • Guest Editor. Journal of Economic Methodology Special Issue: Dani Rodrikâ€™s Economics Rules (2018 Vol. 25, 3).
  • Guest editor (w/Jack Vromen). Journal of Economic Methodology Special Issue: Economics Made Fun (2012, Vol. 19, 3)

Workshop â€“ Conference Organization

  • Member of the local organizing committee. International Network for Economic Methodology (INEM) Conference. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 19-21 August 2019. ~100 participants.
  • Co-organizer (w/ U. Maki & C. Lisciandra) Multiple Models Workshop. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 2-3 October 2018. 10 speakers, ~25 participants.
  • Co-organizer (w/ U. Maki and T. GrÃ¼ne-Yanoff) Workshop: What to make of highly unrealistic models. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 12-13 October 2017. 15 Talks, one poster session, ~30 participants.
  • Co-organizer (w/J. Vromen) Symposium: Economics Made Fun in the face of the economic crisis. Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL. 10-11 December 2010. 12 speakers, ~30 participants.
  • Member of the organizing committee of the TINT Market and Marketization Workshop. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 2010-2014.
  • Organizer of the economics education program Economics for Everyone, BahÃ§eÅŸehir University, Turkeyâ€”aims at providing economics education to the public, 05.2012 â€“ 02.2016.
  • Member of the local organizing committee. European Society for the History of Economic Thought (ESHET) Conference: Competition, Innovation and Rivalry, BoÄŸaziÃ§i University, Istanbul, TR. 19-22 May 2011. ~150 participants
  • Member of the Scientific Committee of EAEPE 2009 Conference in Amsterdam, 2009.
  • Member of the Program Committee of International Conference of Political Economy: Adam Smith Today, 2009.

Research coordination

  • Economic Methodology Research area coordinator, together with Professor Uskali MÃ¤ki, European Association for Evolutionary Political Economy (EAEPE), 2008-present.

Refereeing

  • Erkenntnis, Synthese, European Journal for Philosophy of Science, Journal of Social Ontology, Journal of Institutional Economics, History of Economic Ideas, Journal of Artificial Societies And Social Simulation, Journal of Economic Methodology, Routledge Books.
  • ERC External evaluator. Philosophy. ERC Starter Grants 2018, European Research Council.

Expert duties, assignments and research-based policy-advice

  • Advisor and contributor to the ILO/TEPAV report on Contractual arrangements in Turkeyâ€™s coal mines (2016, International Labour Organization, ILO Office for Turkey. - Ankara: ILO).
  • Prepared Policy Notes for Economic Policy Research Foundation of Turkey, TEPAV | Think-Tank, Ankara, TR, 01.2012â€”07.2017

Other

Research dissemination and communication

  • Blog Editor, Centre for Philosophy of Social Science, University of Helsinki, 2019.
  • Author of the popular science book: Ä°ktisat Nedir?, Ä°letiÅŸim YayÄ±nlarÄ±, (in Turkish, What is Economics?) â€“ 2014.
  • Editor of the popular science book: HayatÄ±n Ä°Ã§indeki Ä°ktisat, Ä°letiÅŸim YaynlarÄ±, (in Turkish, Economics in Everyday Life) â€“ 2019
  • Columnist/Writer, Business HT (03.2015 â€“08.2016). Wall Street Journal Turkey (05.2014 â€“ 12.2014). TEPAV Blog (02.2012â€”12.2014)
  • Blog Editor & Co-Founder, AÃ§Ä±k Ekonomi (Economics Blog, in Turkish), 2012â€”2017.
  • Organizer of Economics for Everyone, BahÃ§eÅŸehir University, TRâ€”aims at providing economics education to the public, 05.2012 â€“ 02.2016.

Administrative responsibilities

  • Coordinator of actvities, Centre for Philosophy of Social Science (TINT), September 2019 â€“ present.
  • Vice Dean, BahÃ§eÅŸehir University, Faculty of Economics, Administrative & Social Sciences, Ä°stanbul, TR, 10.2015 â€“ 05.2016.

Memberships

  • Elected Member of the Executive Committee, International Network for Economic Methodology (INEM), 08.2017â€”present.
  • Methodology of Economics Research Area Coordinator, (w/Uskali MÃ¤ki). European Association for Evolutionary Political Economy. 2008â€”present.
  • Council Member, European Association for Evolutionary Political Economy, January 2008 â€“ January 2010.

Invited keynote lectures (selected)

  • 19.09.2019. Invited Speaker. â€œMultiple model idealization in economicsâ€ Colloque de lancement du RÃ©seau International de Recherche Â« Justice et intÃ©rÃªt Â» / Â« Justice and Interest Â» International Research Network Kick Off Meeting - 19-20 Septempber 2019, Marseilles, France.
  • 27.04.2017. Invited Speaker. "Diversity of models as a means to truer explanations in economics", Higher Seminar in Economics, University of SÃ¶dertÃ¶rn, SWE.
  • 9-10.05.2016. Invited Speaker, â€œThe Invisible Hand in Economicsâ€, The Invisible Hand in Law, Economy and Culture. Workshop on Spontaneous Order, Mechanisms and Unintended Consequences, Warsaw, PL.
  • 25.05.2015. Invited Speaker at the World Bank Development Report 2015 Launch Event in Ankara, TR.
  • 21-23.10.2013. Invited Lecture on history and methodology of economics, UniversitÃ¤t Bayreuth, Bayreuth, DE.
  • 2.09.2013. Invited Lecture. â€œInstitutions, history and context-specific analysisâ€, History of Economic Thought, Economic Philosophy and Economic History 16th Summer School, Middle East Technical University, Ankara, TR.
  • 15-18.06.2006. Invited Speaker. â€œMicromotives and Macrobehaviorâ€, Plenary Session, 2nd International Conference on Business Management and Economics, Ä°zmir, TR

entry.title: Teaching
entry.summary: 2021-22 Fall - Philosophy of Economics (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (Online via Zoom) Spring - Paradigms in…
entry.content:
2021-22
